Accessories from Fujifilm

Shoe-mounted flash units


EF-X500: In addition to manual Guide Number of 50/164 (ISO lowing it to be used at shutter support for the optional EF-BP1 control, it can be used as a remote flash photography.and TTL flash control, this clip-on flash unit has a 100, m/ft.) and supports FP (high-speed sync), al- speeds that exceed the flash sync speed. Featuring battery pack and Fujifilm optical wireless flash commander or flash unit for remote wireless
EF-BP1: A battery pack for EF-X500 flash units. Takes up to 8 AA batteries.
EF-60: In addition to manual and TTL flash control, this flash has Guide Number of 60/197 (ISO 100, m/ft.) and FP lowing it to be used at shutter speeds the flash sync speed. It can be used as remote flash under the control optional mander.clip-on unit a supports (high-speed sync), al- that exceed also of an EF-W1 wireless com-
EF-W1: With support for the NAS* wireless communication standard developed by Nissin Japan, this wireless flash commander can be with optional clip-on flash units and other NAS-compliant units. * NAS is a registered trademark of Nissin Japan Ltd.used EF-60
EF-42: This clip-on flash unit has a supports manual andGuide Number of 42/137 (ISO 100, m/ft.) and TTL flash control.
EF-X20: This clip-on flash supports manualunit has a Guide Number of 20/65 (ISO 100, m/ft.) and and TTL flash control.
EF-20: This clip-on flash unit has a Guide Number of 20/65 (ISO 100, m/ft.) and supports TTL flash control (manual flash control is not supported).

Cooling fans


FAN-001: See "Cooling Fans" (�� 416).


Remote releases


RR-100: Use to reduce camera shake or keep the shutter open during a time
exposure. The RR-100 has a connector with a diameter of 2.5 mm; a third-party
⌀2.5 mm to 3.5 mm adapter is required for connection to the camera.


Stereo microphones


MIC-ST1: An external microphone for movie recording.


Technical
Notes
12
421
